modules.description: This module handles network communication for IRC clients using Unix sockets. It provides functions to connect to servers via IP address and port, read from and write to connections, and manage socket descriptors. Concrete use cases include establishing TCP connections, sending IRC commands, and receiving server responses in real-time.

This module implements IRC client functionality for Unix systems, using Unix sockets to connect to servers, send commands like JOIN and PRIVMSG, and handle incoming messages through callbacks. It manages connection state with `connection_t`, parses raw messages, and supports persistent connections via `reconnect_loop`. You can build IRC bots that react to channel events, send messages, or maintain reliable TCP connections to IRC servers. Key operations include connecting to a server, sending commands, and processing messages in real-time.
